page.title: 04Housing - A typical cottage
page.content: In comparison with the extensive Deene Hall and the housing facilities of the farms, visits to other homes offered a stark contrast...with cottages being compact, having tiny rooms and low ceilings. A typical example was Â£Rose Cottage', in Deene...part of which was once the village bakery. Originally a semi- detached property the house has been converted into a single home, but even now it is small compared with modern homes. The tiny rooms had low doors, large fireplaces, uneven floors, small windows and ceilings just above head height. In the scullery there were still signs of the baker's oven...and walls of painted stone. The bedrooms were at the top of steep stairs, leading up at the side of the living room.
